title: 114_hr284
content: The Act titled "Medicare DMEPOS Competitive Bidding Improvement Act of 2015" requires bid surety bonds and state licensure for entities submitting bids under the Medicare DMEPOS competitive acquisition program. The Medicare DMEPOS Competitive Bidding Improvement Act of 2015 mandates bid surety bonds for entities participating in competitive acquisition rounds from January 1, 2017, to January 1, 2019. The Medicare DMEPOS Competitive Bidding Improvement Act of 2015 requires bid surety bonds for entities in competitive acquisition rounds, with amounts ranging from $50,000 to $100,000 per area. Bidders below the median bid rate who are offered but decline a contract must adhere to specific treatment guidelines. The Medicare DMEPOS Competitive Bidding Improvement Act of 2015 mandates bid surety bonds for entities in competitive acquisition rounds. Bidders who decline a contract after being offered must forfeit their bid bond, and the Secretary will collect on it. Other bidders who do not meet bid forfeiture requirements will face specific treatment guidelines. The Medicare DMEPOS Competitive Bidding Improvement Act of 2015 requires bid surety bonds for entities in competitive acquisition rounds. Entities failing to meet bid forfeiture conditions will have their bid bond returned within 90 days. State licensure requirements must also be met by the entity. The Secretary of Health and Human Services retains authority to require State licensure for entities in the Medicare competitive acquisition program. The Comptroller General will study the impact of bid surety bond requirements on small suppliers participating in the program. A report must be submitted within 6 months of the first awarded contracts. The Comptroller General will submit a report to Congress on the impact of bid surety bond requirements on small suppliers in the Medicare competitive acquisition program, with recommendations for changes to ensure robust participation. The House of Representatives passed a bill regarding bid surety bond requirements for small suppliers in the Medicare DMEPOS competition acquisition program.
